pstdint.h
1 /* A portable stdint.h
2  *
3  * This file has been modified for use within ADTF
4  *
5  ****************************************************************************
6  * BSD License:
7  ****************************************************************************
8  *
9  * Copyright (c) 2005-2007 Paul Hsieh
10  * All rights reserved.
11  *
12  * Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
13  * modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions
14  * are met:
15  *
16  * 1. Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright
17  * notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.
18  * 2. Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright
19  * notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the
20  * documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
21  * 3. The name of the author may not be used to endorse or promote products
22  * derived from this software without specific prior written permission.
23  *
24  * THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE AUTHOR ``AS IS'' AND ANY EXPRESS OR
25  * IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES
26  * OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED.
27  * IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHOR BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT,
28  * INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
29  * NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE,
30  * DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY
31  * THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT
32  * (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF
33  * THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
34  *
35  ****************************************************************************
36  *
37  * Version 0.1.11
38  *
39  * The ANSI C standard committee, for the C99 standard, specified the
40  * inclusion of a new standard include file called stdint.h. This is
41  * a very useful and long desired include file which contains several
42  * very precise definitions for integer scalar types that is
43  * critically important for making portable several classes of
44  * applications including cryptography, hashing, variable length
45  * integer libraries and so on. But for most developers its likely
46  * useful just for programming sanity.
47  *
48  * The problem is that most compiler vendors have decided not to
49  * implement the C99 standard, and the next C++ language standard
50  * (which has a lot more mindshare these days) will be a long time in
51  * coming and its unknown whether or not it will include stdint.h or
52  * how much adoption it will have. Either way, it will be a long time
53  * before all compilers come with a stdint.h and it also does nothing
54  * for the extremely large number of compilers available today which
55  * do not include this file, or anything comparable to it.
56  *
57  * So that's what this file is all about. Its an attempt to build a
58  * single universal include file that works on as many platforms as
59  * possible to deliver what stdint.h is supposed to. A few things
60  * that should be noted about this file:
61  *
62  * 1) It is not guaranteed to be portable and/or present an identical
63  * interface on all platforms. The extreme variability of the
64  * ANSI C standard makes this an impossibility right from the
65  * very get go. Its really only meant to be useful for the vast
66  * majority of platforms that possess the capability of
67  * implementing usefully and precisely defined, standard sized
68  * integer scalars. Systems which are not intrinsically 2s
69  * complement may produce invalid constants.
70  *
71  * 2) There is an unavoidable use of non-reserved symbols.
72  *
73  * 3) Other standard include files are invoked.
74  *
75  * 4) This file may come in conflict with future platforms that do
76  * include stdint.h. The hope is that one or the other can be
77  * used with no real difference.
78  *
79  * 5) In the current verison, if your platform can't represent
80  * tInt32, tInt16 and tInt8, it just dumps out with a compiler
81  * error.
82  *
83  * 6) 64 bit integers may or may not be defined. Test for their
84  * presence with the test: #ifdef INT64_MAX or #ifdef UINT64_MAX.
85  * Note that this is different from the C99 specification which
86  * requires the existence of 64 bit support in the compiler. If
87  * this is not defined for your platform, yet it is capable of
88  * dealing with 64 bits then it is because this file has not yet
89  * been extended to cover all of your system's capabilities.
90  *
91  * 7) (u)intptr_t may or may not be defined. Test for its presence
92  * with the test: #ifdef PTRDIFF_MAX. If this is not defined
93  * for your platform, then it is because this file has not yet
94  * been extended to cover all of your system's capabilities, not
95  * because its optional.
96  *
97  * 8) The following might not been defined even if your platform is
98  * capable of defining it:
99  *
100  * WCHAR_MIN
101  * WCHAR_MAX
102  * (u)tInt64
103  * PTRDIFF_MIN
104  * PTRDIFF_MAX
105  * (u)intptr_t
106  *
107  * 9) The following have not been defined:
108  *
109  * WINT_MIN
110  * WINT_MAX
111  *
112  * 10) The criteria for defining (u)int_least(*)_t isn't clear,
113  * except for systems which don't have a type that precisely
114  * defined 8, 16, or 32 bit types (which this include file does
115  * not support anyways). Default definitions have been given.
116  *
117  * 11) The criteria for defining (u)int_fast(*)_t isn't something I
118  * would trust to any particular compiler vendor or the ANSI C
119  * committee. It is well known that "compatible systems" are
120  * commonly created that have very different performance
121  * characteristics from the systems they are compatible with,
122  * especially those whose vendors make both the compiler and the
123  * system. Default definitions have been given, but its strongly
124  * recommended that users never use these definitions for any
125  * reason (they do *NOT* deliver any serious guarantee of
126  * improved performance -- not in this file, nor any vendor's
127  * stdint.h).
128  *
129  * 12) The following macros:
130  *
131  * PRINTF_INTMAX_MODIFIER
132  * PRINTF_INT64_MODIFIER
133  * PRINTF_INT32_MODIFIER
134  * PRINTF_INT16_MODIFIER
135  * PRINTF_LEAST64_MODIFIER
136  * PRINTF_LEAST32_MODIFIER
137  * PRINTF_LEAST16_MODIFIER
138  * PRINTF_INTPTR_MODIFIER
139  *
140  * are strings which have been defined as the modifiers required
141  * for the "d", "u" and "x" printf formats to correctly output
142  * (u)intmax_t, (u)tInt64, (u)tInt32, (u)tInt16, (u)least64_t,
143  * (u)least32_t, (u)least16_t and (u)intptr_t types respectively.
144  * PRINTF_INTPTR_MODIFIER is not defined for some systems which
145  * provide their own stdint.h. PRINTF_INT64_MODIFIER is not
146  * defined if INT64_MAX is not defined. These are an extension
147  * beyond what C99 specifies must be in stdint.h.
148  *
149  * In addition, the following macros are defined:
150  *
151  * PRINTF_INTMAX_HEX_WIDTH
152  * PRINTF_INT64_HEX_WIDTH
153  * PRINTF_INT32_HEX_WIDTH
154  * PRINTF_INT16_HEX_WIDTH
155  * PRINTF_INT8_HEX_WIDTH
156  * PRINTF_INTMAX_DEC_WIDTH
157  * PRINTF_INT64_DEC_WIDTH
158  * PRINTF_INT32_DEC_WIDTH
159  * PRINTF_INT16_DEC_WIDTH
160  * PRINTF_INT8_DEC_WIDTH
161  *
162  * Which specifies the maximum number of characters required to
163  * print the number of that type in either hexadecimal or decimal.
164  * These are an extension beyond what C99 specifies must be in
165  * stdint.h.
166  *
167  * Compilers tested (all with 0 warnings at their highest respective
168  * settings): Borland Turbo C 2.0, WATCOM C/C++ 11.0 (16 bits and 32
169  * bits), Microsoft Visual C++ 6.0 (32 bit), Microsoft Visual Studio
170  * .net (VC7), Intel C++ 4.0, GNU gcc v3.3.3
171  *
172  * This file should be considered a work in progress. Suggestions for
173  * improvements, especially those which increase coverage are strongly
174  * encouraged.
175  *
176  * Acknowledgements
177  *
178  * The following people have made significant contributions to the
179  * development and testing of this file:
180  *
181  * Chris Howie
182  * John Steele Scott
183  * Dave Thorup
184  *
185  */
186 
187 #include <stddef.h>
188 #include <limits.h>
189 #include <signal.h>
190 
191 /*
192  * For gcc with _STDINT_H, fill in the PRINTF_INT*_MODIFIER macros, and
193  * do nothing else. On the Mac OS X version of gcc this is _STDINT_H_.
194  */
195 
196 #if ((defined(__STDC__) && __STDC__ && __STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L) \
197  || (defined (__WATCOMC__) && (!defined(_STDINT_H_INCLUDED) || __WATCOMC__ >= 1250)) \
198  || (defined(__GNUC__) \
199  && ((!defined(_STDINT_H) || !defined(_STDINT_H_)) \
200  || !defined(_PSTDINT_H_INCLUDED))) )
201 
202  #include <stdint.h>
203  #define _PSTDINT_H_INCLUDED
204 
205  /*
206  * Something really weird is going on with Open Watcom. Just pull some of
207  * these duplicated definitions from Open Watcom's stdint.h file for now.
208  */
209  # if defined (__WATCOMC__) && __WATCOMC__ >= 1250
210  # if !defined (INT64_C)
211  # define INT64_C(x) (x + (INT64_MAX - INT64_MAX))
212  # endif
213  # if !defined (UINT64_C)
214  # define UINT64_C(x) (x + (UINT64_MAX - UINT64_MAX))
215  # endif
216  # if !defined (INT32_C)
217  # define INT32_C(x) (x + (INT32_MAX - INT32_MAX))
218  # endif
219  # if !defined (UINT32_C)
220  # define UINT32_C(x) (x + (UINT32_MAX - UINT32_MAX))
221  # endif
222  # if !defined (INT16_C)
223  # define INT16_C(x) (x)
224  # endif
225  # if !defined (UINT16_C)
226  # define UINT16_C(x) (x)
227  # endif
228  # if !defined (INT8_C)
229  # define INT8_C(x) (x)
230  # endif
231  # if !defined (UINT8_C)
232  # define UINT8_C(x) (x)
233  # endif
234 
235 
236  # if !defined (UINT64_MAX)
237  # define UINT64_MAX 18446744073709551615ULL
238  # endif
239  # if !defined (INT64_MAX)
240  # define INT64_MAX 9223372036854775807LL
241  # endif
242  # if !defined (UINT32_MAX)
243  # define UINT32_MAX 4294967295UL
244  # endif
245  # if !defined (INT32_MAX)
246  # define INT32_MAX 2147483647L
247  # endif
248  # if !defined (INTMAX_MAX)
249  # define INTMAX_MAX INT64_MAX
250  # endif
251  # if !defined (INTMAX_MIN)
252  # define INTMAX_MIN INT64_MIN
253  # endif
254  # endif
255 
256  typedef int8_t tInt8; /* .i8... */
257  typedef uint8_t tUInt8; /* .ui8... */
258  typedef int16_t tInt16; /* .i16... */
259  typedef uint16_t tUInt16; /* .ui16.. */
260  typedef int32_t tInt32; /* .i32... */
261  typedef uint32_t tUInt32; /* .ui32.. */
262  typedef int64_t tInt64; /* .i64... */
263  typedef uint64_t tUInt64; /* .ui64.. */
264 
265 
266 #endif //_PSTDINT_H_INCLUDED
267 
268 
269 #ifndef _PSTDINT_H_INCLUDED
270 #define _PSTDINT_H_INCLUDED
271 
272 
273 #ifndef SIZE_MAX
274 # define SIZE_MAX (~(size_t)0)
275 #endif
276 
277 /*
278  * Deduce the type assignments from limits.h under the assumption that
279  * integer sizes in bits are powers of 2, and follow the ANSI
280  * definitions.
281  */
282 
283 #ifndef UINT8_MAX
284 # define UINT8_MAX 0xff
285 #endif
286 #ifndef tUInt8
287 # if (UCHAR_MAX == UINT8_MAX) || defined (S_SPLINT_S)
288  typedef unsigned char tUInt8;
289 # define UINT8_C(v) ((tUInt8) v)
290 # else
291 # error "Platform not supported"
292 # endif
293 #endif
294 
295 #ifndef INT8_MAX
296 # define INT8_MAX 0x7f
297 #endif
298 #ifndef INT8_MIN
299 # define INT8_MIN INT8_C(0x80)
300 #endif
301 #ifndef tInt8
302 # if (SCHAR_MAX == INT8_MAX) || defined (S_SPLINT_S)
303  typedef signed char tInt8;
304 # define INT8_C(v) ((tInt8) v)
305 # else
306 # error "Platform not supported"
307 # endif
308 #endif
309 
310 #ifndef UINT16_MAX
311 # define UINT16_MAX 0xffff
312 #endif
313 #ifndef tUInt16
314 #if (UINT_MAX == UINT16_MAX) || defined (S_SPLINT_S)
315  typedef unsigned int tUInt16;
316 # ifndef PRINTF_INT16_MODIFIER
317 # define PRINTF_INT16_MODIFIER ""
318 # endif
319 # define UINT16_C(v) ((tUInt16) (v))
320 #elif (USHRT_MAX == UINT16_MAX)
321  typedef unsigned short tUInt16;
322 # define UINT16_C(v) ((tUInt16) (v))
323 # ifndef PRINTF_INT16_MODIFIER
324 # define PRINTF_INT16_MODIFIER "h"
325 # endif
326 #else
327 #error "Platform not supported"
328 #endif
329 #endif
330 
331 #ifndef INT16_MAX
332 # define INT16_MAX 0x7fff
333 #endif
334 #ifndef INT16_MIN
335 # define INT16_MIN INT16_C(0x8000)
336 #endif
337 #ifndef tInt16
338 #if (INT_MAX == INT16_MAX) || defined (S_SPLINT_S)
339  typedef signed int tInt16;
340 # define INT16_C(v) ((tInt16) (v))
341 # ifndef PRINTF_INT16_MODIFIER
342 # define PRINTF_INT16_MODIFIER ""
343 # endif
344 #elif (SHRT_MAX == INT16_MAX)
345  typedef signed short tInt16;
346 # define INT16_C(v) ((tInt16) (v))
347 # ifndef PRINTF_INT16_MODIFIER
348 # define PRINTF_INT16_MODIFIER "h"
349 # endif
350 #else
351 #error "Platform not supported"
352 #endif
353 #endif
354 
355 #ifndef UINT32_MAX
356 # define UINT32_MAX (0xffffffffUL)
357 #endif
358 #ifndef tUInt32
359 #if (ULONG_MAX == UINT32_MAX) || defined (S_SPLINT_S)
360  typedef unsigned long tUInt32;
361 # define UINT32_C(v) v ## UL
362 # ifndef PRINTF_INT32_MODIFIER
363 # define PRINTF_INT32_MODIFIER "l"
364 # endif
365 #elif (UINT_MAX == UINT32_MAX)
366  typedef unsigned int tUInt32;
367 # ifndef PRINTF_INT32_MODIFIER
368 # define PRINTF_INT32_MODIFIER ""
369 # endif
370 # define UINT32_C(v) v ## U
371 #elif (USHRT_MAX == UINT32_MAX)
372  typedef unsigned short tUInt32;
373 # define UINT32_C(v) ((unsigned short) (v))
374 # ifndef PRINTF_INT32_MODIFIER
375 # define PRINTF_INT32_MODIFIER ""
376 # endif
377 #else
378 #error "Platform not supported"
379 #endif
380 #endif
381 
382 #ifndef INT32_MAX
383 # define INT32_MAX (0x7fffffffL)
384 #endif
385 #ifndef INT32_MIN
386 # define INT32_MIN INT32_C(0x80000000)
387 #endif
388 #ifndef tInt32
389 #if (LONG_MAX == INT32_MAX) || defined (S_SPLINT_S)
390  typedef signed long tInt32;
391 # define INT32_C(v) v ## L
392 # ifndef PRINTF_INT32_MODIFIER
393 # define PRINTF_INT32_MODIFIER "l"
394 # endif
395 #elif (INT_MAX == INT32_MAX)
396  typedef signed int tInt32;
397 # define INT32_C(v) v
398 # ifndef PRINTF_INT32_MODIFIER
399 # define PRINTF_INT32_MODIFIER ""
400 # endif
401 #elif (SHRT_MAX == INT32_MAX)
402  typedef signed short tInt32;
403 # define INT32_C(v) ((short) (v))
404 # ifndef PRINTF_INT32_MODIFIER
405 # define PRINTF_INT32_MODIFIER ""
406 # endif
407 #else
408 #error "Platform not supported"
409 #endif
410 #endif
411 
412 /*
413  * The macro stdint_int64_defined is temporarily used to record
414  * whether or not 64 integer support is available. It must be
415  * defined for any 64 integer extensions for new platforms that are
416  * added.
417  */
418 
419 #if !defined (stdint_int64_defined)
420 #if (defined(__STDC__) && defined(__STDC_VERSION__)) || defined (S_SPLINT_S)
421 # if (__STDC__ && __STDC_VERSION >= 199901L) || defined (S_SPLINT_S)
422 # define stdint_int64_defined
423  typedef long long tInt64;
424  typedef unsigned long long tUInt64;
425 # define UINT64_C(v) v ## ULL
426 # define INT64_C(v) v ## LL
427 # ifndef PRINTF_INT64_MODIFIER
428 # define PRINTF_INT64_MODIFIER "ll"
429 # endif
430 # endif
431 #endif
432 #endif
433 
434 #if !defined (stdint_int64_defined)
435 # if defined(__GNUC__)
436 # define stdint_int64_defined
437  __extension__ typedef long long tInt64;
438  __extension__ typedef unsigned long long tUInt64;
439 # define UINT64_C(v) v ## ULL
440 # define INT64_C(v) v ## LL
441 # ifndef PRINTF_INT64_MODIFIER
442 # define PRINTF_INT64_MODIFIER "ll"
443 # endif
444 # elif defined(__MWERKS__) || defined (__SUNPRO_C) || defined (__SUNPRO_CC) || defined (__APPLE_CC__) || defined (_LONG_LONG) || defined (_CRAYC) || defined (S_SPLINT_S)
445 # define stdint_int64_defined
446  typedef long long tInt64;
447  typedef unsigned long long tUInt64;
448 # define UINT64_C(v) v ## ULL
449 # define INT64_C(v) v ## LL
450 # ifndef PRINTF_INT64_MODIFIER
451 # define PRINTF_INT64_MODIFIER "ll"
452 # endif
453 # elif (defined(__WATCOMC__) && defined(__WATCOM_INT64__)) || (defined(_MSC_VER) && _INTEGRAL_MAX_BITS >= 64) || (defined (__BORLANDC__) && __BORLANDC__ > 0x460) || defined (__alpha) || defined (__DECC)
454 # define stdint_int64_defined
455  typedef __int64 tInt64;
456  typedef unsigned __int64 tUInt64;
457 # define UINT64_C(v) v ## UI64
458 # define INT64_C(v) v ## I64
459 # ifndef PRINTF_INT64_MODIFIER
460 # define PRINTF_INT64_MODIFIER "I64"
461 # endif
462 # endif
463 #endif
464 
465 #if !defined (LONG_LONG_MAX) && defined (INT64_C)
466 # define LONG_LONG_MAX INT64_C (9223372036854775807)
467 #endif
468 #ifndef ULONG_LONG_MAX
469 # define ULONG_LONG_MAX UINT64_C (18446744073709551615)
470 #endif
471 
472 #if !defined (INT64_MAX) && defined (INT64_C)
473 # define INT64_MAX INT64_C (9223372036854775807)
474 #endif
475 #if !defined (INT64_MIN) && defined (INT64_C)
476 # define INT64_MIN INT64_C (-9223372036854775808)
477 #endif
478 #if !defined (UINT64_MAX) && defined (INT64_C)
479 # define UINT64_MAX UINT64_C (18446744073709551615)
480 #endif
481 
482 /*
483  * Width of hexadecimal for number field.
484  */
485 
486 #ifndef PRINTF_INT64_HEX_WIDTH
487 # define PRINTF_INT64_HEX_WIDTH "16"
488 #endif
489 #ifndef PRINTF_INT32_HEX_WIDTH
490 # define PRINTF_INT32_HEX_WIDTH "8"
491 #endif
492 #ifndef PRINTF_INT16_HEX_WIDTH
493 # define PRINTF_INT16_HEX_WIDTH "4"
494 #endif
495 #ifndef PRINTF_INT8_HEX_WIDTH
496 # define PRINTF_INT8_HEX_WIDTH "2"
497 #endif
498 
499 #ifndef PRINTF_INT64_DEC_WIDTH
500 # define PRINTF_INT64_DEC_WIDTH "20"
501 #endif
502 #ifndef PRINTF_INT32_DEC_WIDTH
503 # define PRINTF_INT32_DEC_WIDTH "10"
504 #endif
505 #ifndef PRINTF_INT16_DEC_WIDTH
506 # define PRINTF_INT16_DEC_WIDTH "5"
507 #endif
508 #ifndef PRINTF_INT8_DEC_WIDTH
509 # define PRINTF_INT8_DEC_WIDTH "3"
510 #endif

513 #endif
